description: Integer ambiguity resolution is a challenge in positioning systems where the exact integer values of certain parameters need to be determined. This is particularly important in Global Navigation Satellite Systems (GNSS) to achieve high-precision positioning.
you_have_this_if: You are working with GNSS data.
You need to achieve a positioning success rate above 98%.
You are facing high-dimensional optimization problems.
You encounter ambiguities in integer values during data processing.
You require a solution that balances speed and accuracy.

approaches.best_for: when you need to resolve integer ambiguities in GNSS applications with high precision.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While SAALO can achieve high accuracy, it may require more computational resources compared to simpler methods.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need to resolve complex integer ambiguities in GNSS applications with a focus on high precision.

start_here: Start with the Simulated Annealing Ant Lion Optimizer (SAALO) as it is specifically designed for high-precision integer ambiguity resolution in GNSS applications.
